segment.source: How to Delete All Virtual Applications by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Delete All Virtual Applications by Using the Command Line

segment.source: How to Delete All Virtual Applications by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Delete All Virtual Applications by Using the Command Line

segment.source: How to Delete All Virtual Applications by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Delete All Virtual Applications by Using the Command Line

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to delete all virtual applications from a specific computer.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to delete all virtual applications from a specific computer.

segment.source: When all applications are deleted from a package, the Application Virtualization (App-V) Client also deletes the package.
segment.target: When all applications are deleted from a package, the Application Virtualization (App-V) Client also deletes the package.

segment.source: Run the following command to delete all applications for the user account under which the command is run.
segment.target: Run the following command to delete all applications for the user account under which the command is run.

segment.source: If you run the command with the optional /GLOBAL switch, using an account with administrative rights, all applications are deleted for all users.
segment.target: If you run the command with the optional /GLOBAL switch, using an account with administrative rights, all applications are deleted for all users.

segment.source: When all applications are deleted from a package, the Application Virtualization (App-V) Client also deletes the package.
segment.target: When all applications are deleted from a package, the Application Virtualization (App-V) Client also deletes the package.
